results.title: Indian eyes on the future
results.brief_description: Shows the progress India is making towards an indpendent future. Highly competent scientists and technologists argue that India must make herself technologically independent quickly, and to do this she must invest heavily in fundamental research, even though many millions of her people still live in squalor. Shows the Plutonium factory near Bombay, the new steel town of Dargapur, and the first atomic power station under construction at Taraput. Presents the enormous problem of education facing India.

results.title: Indian crafts: Hopi, Navajo and Iroquois
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Nancy Creedman
results.brief_description: An introduction to the different crafts of three North American Indian tribes. Crafts shown include the weaving of the yucca plant into baskets by the Hopi tribe; the weaving of blankets and the making of silver jewellery by the navajo tribe; and the carving of special masks by the Iroquois tribe from basswood trees.

results.title: Indian art through the ages
results.creator_credit: Documentary Films of India, M. Bhavnani and Mohan Wadhwani
results.brief_description: The camera explores exhibits at a display of fine arts in New Delhi, India to reveal the artistic achievements of past civilizations. Shows terracotta models which decorated the city of Mohenjodaro, 4500 years ago; includes specimens of Maurya, Kushan, Gupta and Chola art.

results.title: India: urban conditions
results.brief_description: Shows the effect of rapid population growth in Indian cities, particularly Calcutta, when rural workers migrate to the cities in an attempt to find work and feed their families. By studying the family of Sarat we learn of the problems of low wages, lack of work, inadequate housing and clothing, undernourishment and little or no education.

results.title: India: two girls one camera
results.creator_credit: Food For Thought, Kylie Washington and Citt Williams
results.brief_description: Two childhood friends capture their thoughts and feelings as they travel to India and encounter a clash between Eastern and Western cultures which varies from the trivial to the tragic.

results.title: India: the struggle for food
results.brief_description: Following the life of a farmer in the upper Ganges Valley, we see the problems which beset India’s food production. the use of primitive methods of farming, the growing rural population and the resulting migration of farmers to the cities, all contribute to low crop yields. Under government auspices, the Community Development Program is trying to improve farming methods and enrich village life.

results.title: India: an Introduction
results.creator_credit: Worldview Productions, Sam Bryan, Michael Camerini and James MacDonald
results.brief_description: Shows India as a nation varied in cultures, religions and customs, in climate, dress, diet, history, and language. Looks at industries and farming. Animated maps are used to locate the Himalayas, farmlands, paths of the monsoon rains, population density and India’s many alphabets and languages.

results.title: India: A Personal Encounter
results.creator_credit: Michael Dillon Film Enterprises and Michael Dillon
results.brief_description: Sir Edmund Hillary and friends journey from the ocean at India’s southernmost tip to the snows of Himalayas, a pilgrimage similar to those taken by millions of Hindus each year. Travelling by such unconventional means as canal boat, camel, elephant and bullock cart as well as by foot, bicycle, train and an old river sailboat, they were able to see the real India, through the tropical backwaters of Kerala, the deserts of Rajasthan, along the Ganges and into the Himalayas. They saw snake boat races, a heart-stopping martial arts display with flexible swords, a gathering of 10,000 camels, an ancient fort city in the Thar desert and much, much more. A stunningly photographed record of the remarkable sights and experiences of this remarkable journey - an enthralling family adventure.

results.title: India, Pakistan and the Union of India
results.brief_description: An account of the geography and sociological conditions existing in present-day India: Hindu and Muslim religions; important economic problems as experienced by a typical peasant family; industry in India; climatic conditions - a period of drought followed by the monsoon season; the spread of education and its effect on the industrial and agricultural life of the country.
